name: mandate
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the authority given to an elected group of people, such as a government, to perform an action or govern a country

example.eg: At the forthcoming elections, the government will be seeking a fresh mandate from the people.
example.egtrans: 在即将到来的选举中，政府将向人民寻求新的支持。

example.eg: The president secured the Congressional mandate to go to war by three votes.
example.egtrans: 总统以3票的优势获得了国会对开战的授权。

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the name of an area of land that has been given to a country by the UN, following or as part of a peace agreement
trans_examp.trans_cn: （联合国授权某国管理的）托管地

name: mandate
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give official permission for something to happen

example.eg: The UN rush to mandate war totally ruled out any alternatives.
example.egtrans: 联合国匆匆授权开战，完全排除了其他选择。

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to order someone to do something

example.eg: Our delegates have been mandated to vote against the proposal at the conference.
example.egtrans: 我们的代表受命在会议上对提议投反对票。
